member.name: IPerPropertyBrowsing.GetDisplayString
member.summary: Retrieves a text string describing the specified property.
member.param: The dispatch identifier of the property whose display name is requested.

A pointer to a variable that receives the display name for the property identified in dispID. The string is allocated by this method using SysAllocString. Upon return, the string is the responsibility of the caller, which must free it with SysFreeString when it is no longer needed.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, and E_UNEXPECTED, as well as the following values.

listheader.description: The display name was successfully returned.
The object does not provide display names for individual properties. The caller has the recourse to check the object's type information for the text name of the object in this case.
The address in pbstr is not valid. For example, it may be NULL.

member.name: IPerPropertyBrowsing.GetPredefinedStrings
member.summary: Retrieves an array description strings for the allowable values that the specified property can accept.
member.param: The dispatch identifier of the property.

A pointer to a caller-allocated, counted array structure that contains the element count and address of a method-allocated array of string pointers. This method also allocates memory for the string values containing the predefined names, and it stores the string pointers in the array. If the method fails, no memory is allocated, and the contents of the structure are undefined.

A pointer to the caller-allocated, counted array structure that contains the element count and address of a method-allocated array of DWORD values. The values in the array can be passed to to retrieve the value associated with the name in the same array position inside pCaStringsOut. If the method fails, no memory is allocated, and the contents of the structure are undefined.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, and E_UNEXPECTED, as well as the following values.

listheader.description: This method is not implemented and predefined names are not supported.
The address in pCaStringsOut or pCaCookiesOut is not valid. For example, either parameter may be NULL.

member.name: IPerPropertyBrowsing.GetPredefinedValue
member.summary: Retrieves the value of the specified property that is associated with a predefined string name. This property is associated with a predefined string name as returned from . The predefined string is identified by a token returned from GetPredefinedStrings.
member.param: The dispatch identifier of the property for which a predefined value is requested.
A token identifying which value to return. The token was previously returned in the pCaCookiesOut array filled by .
A pointer to the VARIANT value for the property.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, and E_UNEXPECTED, as well as the following values.

listheader.description: This object does not support predefined strings or predefined values.
The address in pVarOut is not valid. For example, it may be NULL.

member.name: IPerPropertyBrowsing.MapPropertyToPage
member.summary: Retrieves the CLSID of the property page associated with the specified property.
member.param: The dispatch identifier of the property.
A pointer to the CLSID identifying the property page associated with the property specified by dispID. If this method fails, *pClsid is set to CLSID_NULL.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG and E_UNEXPECTED, as well as the following values.

listheader.description: The object does not support property pages at all or does not support mapping properties to the page CLSID. In other words, this feature of specific property browsing is not supported.
The address in pClsid is not valid. For example, it may be NULL.

member.name: IPerPropertyBrowsing
member.summary: Retrieves the information in the property pages offered by an object.
